sen.j: 餡（あん）あるい餡子（あんこ）とは、饅頭などの中に入れる具のことで、アズキをはじめとする材料を甘く煮た具や、でん粉を糊化した素材を指すことが多い。
sen.e: Bean paste ('an' or 'anko') is an ingredient in manju (buns filled with bean paste) and usually indicates azuki beans or other ingredients boiled with sweeteners or ingredients gelatinized with starch.

Bean paste ('an' or 'anko') is an ingredient in manju (buns filled with bean paste) and usually indicates azuki beans or other ingredients boiled with sweeteners or ingredients gelatinized with starch.

Bean paste ('an' or 'anko') is an ingredient in manju (buns filled with bean paste) and usually indicates azuki beans or other ingredients boiled with sweeteners or ingredients gelatinized with starch.

sen.j: 主にアズキを煮詰めた豆沙餡（小豆餡）を指すことが多く、後に他の豆などを煮た物も餡と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: It usually refers to azuki bean paste with boiled azuki beans however other types of paste using other types of boiled beans have also come to be called 'an'.
Although 'an' usually refers to azuki bean paste made from boiled azuki beans, pastes made using other types of boiled beans are now also called 'an'.
Although 'an' usually refers to azuki bean paste made from boiled azuki beans, pastes made using other types of boiled beans are now also called 'an'.

sen.j: 餡の味付けは、古くは塩で味付けした塩餡が一般的であったが、近世以降砂糖の庶民への普及とともに砂糖餡が一般化した。
sen.e: In olden days bean paste was commonly flavored with salt however in modern times, as sugar came to be used among the people, sugared bean paste came to be the norm.
Bean paste was commonly flavored with salt in the past, but as the use of sugar became more widespread among people in modern times, sugared bean paste became the norm.
Bean paste was commonly flavored with salt in the past, but as the use of sugar became more widespread among people in modern times, sugared bean paste became the norm.

sen.j: さらに、餅の上にかけるものも餡というようになり、「あんかけ」などに使う、でん粉に水分を加えて加熱し、糊化したものも葛餡など、餡という言葉で呼ぶようになった。
sen.e: Furthermore, the paste on top of rice cakes also came to be called 'an' as well as the food dressed with liquid starch called 'ankake' in which water is added to starch which is heated and gelatinized.

Furthermore, the paste on top of rice cakes also came to be called 'an', as is the liquid starch made from water added to starch and heated to form gelatin, which is used in food dressings like 'ankake'.

Furthermore, the paste on top of rice cakes also came to be called 'an', as is the liquid starch made from water added to starch and heated to form gelatin, which is used in food dressings like 'ankake'.

sen.j: 逆に、餡と同じく、菓子の中に包み込まれる具であっても、ジャム、クリーム (食品)、チョコレート、ピーナッツバターなど、西洋風のものは餡とは呼ばれず、別のものと捉えられている。
sen.e: Conversely, although other ingredients are wrapped inside cakes like 'an', Western ingredients such as jam, cream (food), chocolate or peanut butter are not called 'an' but are considered as something else.
Conversely, although Western ingredients such as jams, cream (food), chocolate or peanut butter are wrapped inside cakes like 'an', these are not called 'an' but are considered something else.
Conversely, although Western ingredients such as jams, cream (food), chocolate or peanut butter are wrapped inside cakes like 'an', these are not called 'an' but are considered something else.

sen.j: 中華料理では小麦粉などで作った皮の中身として包みこまれる具を指すが、一般的な菓子で使われているものについては、仏教寺院などで肉食禁があるため、アズキを煮たものを他の具の代用にし、それが広まったからとされている。
sen.e: In Chinese cooking 'an' indicates ingredients wrapped in a cake made of flour however for 'an' used in common cakes, as Buddhist temples forbade the eating of meat, boiled azuki beans were used in place of other ingredients and it it thought that this practice spread from the temples.

In Chinese cooking 'an' refers to ingredients wrapped in a cake made of flour, but the practice of using boiled azuki beans in common cakes in place of other ingredients is thought to have spread from Buddhist temples, which forbade the eating of meat.

In Chinese cooking 'an' refers to ingredients wrapped in a cake made of flour, but the practice of using boiled azuki beans in common cakes in place of other ingredients is thought to have spread from Buddhist temples, which forbade the eating of meat.

sen.j: 中国において、料理にかける餡は「芡 qiàn」といい、別の概念である。
sen.e: In China the type of 'an' used in cooking is called qiàn and is a separate concept.
In China the type of 'an' used in cooking is called qiàn and is a separate concept.
In China the type of 'an' used in cooking is called 'qiàn' and is a separate concept.

sen.j: - 饅頭などに入れられる最も一般的な餡であり、アズキの皮の状態および有無により種類が分かれる。
sen.e: This is the most common type of bean paste used in manju (cakes with bean paste) and the types are distinguished according to the type of cake wrapping around the azuki bean paste or whether there is a cake wrapping or not.

This is the most common type of bean paste used in manju (cakes with bean paste), which are distinguished by the type of cake wrapping around the azuki bean paste or whether there is a cake wrapping or not.
This is the most common type of bean paste used in manju (cakes with bean paste), which are distinguished by the state of the skin of beans or whether there is a skin or not.
sen.cmt: 「アズキの皮の有無」が「アズキの有無」になっていたので訂正しました。

tit.j: 粒餡（つぶあん）・小倉餡（おぐらあん）

sen.j: - 小豆を砂糖で煮詰めたもの。
sen.e: These are types of bean paste made by boiling azuki with sugar.
These are types of bean paste made by boiling azuki with sugar.
These are types of bean paste made by boiling azuki with sugar.

sen.j: 小豆の粒が、鹿の斑紋に似ていることから、鹿といえばモミジ、モミジと言えば紅葉で有名な小倉山（京都）との連想から。
sen.e: The name originates from the chain of thought that azuki beans look like the dapples on a deer and deer evoke Japanese maple leaves and Japanese maple leaves evoke the famous Mt. Ogura (Kyoto).
The name originates from the chain of thought where azuki beans look like the dapples on a deer, and deer evoke Japanese maple leaves which evoke the famous Mt. Ogura (Kyoto).
The name originates from the chain of thought where azuki beans look like the dapples on a deer, and deer evoke Japanese maple leaves which evoke the famous Mt. Ogura (Kyoto).

sen.j: - 粒餡をつぶしたもの。
sen.e: This is 'tsubu-an' bean paste that has been mashed.
This is 'tsubu-an' paste made by mashing beans.
This is 'tsubu-an' paste made by mashing beans.

sen.j: - 生餡に砂糖を加え練り上げたもの
sen.e: This is bean paste that has sugar added and is strained
This is bean paste to which sugar has been added and the paste strained
This is bean paste to which sugar has been added and the paste strained

sen.j: - 生餡の水分を飛ばして粉末にしたもの。
sen.e: This is bean paste that has had the moisture evaporated and is a powder.
This is bean paste from which the moisture has been evaporated to form a powder.
This is bean paste from which the moisture has been evaporated to form a powder.

sen.j: 使う時は水分を加えて戻す。
sen.e: It is reconstituted with water when used.
It is reconstituted for use by adding water.
It is reconstituted for use by adding water.

tit.j: 白餡（インゲンまたは白アズキ）
tit.e: White bean paste (kidney beans or white azuki)
White bean paste (kidney beans or white azuki)
White bean paste (kidney beans or white azuki)

sen.j: - 小豆を用いた餡と比較して小豆色ではないため、この名称が付けられている。
sen.e: It is called this as the color is different when compared with bean paste made using azuki beans.
This 'an' has be so named because the color is different when compared with bean paste made using azuki beans.
This 'an' has be so named because the color is different when compared with bean paste made using azuki beans.

sen.j: 粒餡と漉し餡があるが、後者が一般的。
sen.e: There are two types of bean paste, tsubu-an and koshi-an however the latter is the most common.
Although there are two types of bean paste, tsubu-an and koshi-an, the latter is the most common.
Although there are two types of bean paste, tsubu-an and koshi-an, the latter is the most common.

sen.j: 饅頭の皮などにも使用される。
sen.e: It is also used as a wrapping in manju (bean cakes).
It is also used as a wrapping in manju (bean cakes).
It is also used as a wrapping in manju (bean cakes).

sen.j: 他の味付けや色を加えられ練り切りなどの下地にされることも多い。
sen.e: Other flavors and colors are often added and it is used as a base for Japanese cakes called 'nerikiri.'
Often it is used as a base for Japanese cakes called 'nerikiri' after adding other flavors and colors.
Often it is used as a base for Japanese cakes called 'nerikiri' after adding other flavors and colors.

sen.j: - 枝豆の餡、宮城県と山形県の郷土料理。
sen.e: These are cakes made from mashed green soybeans and are a specialty of Miyagi Prefecture and Yamagata Prefecture.
These are cakes made from mashed green soybeans and are a specialty of Miyagi Prefecture and Yamagata Prefecture.
It is made from green soybeans and is a specialty of Miyagi Prefecture and Yamagata Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「ずんだ餅」ではなく「ずんだ餡」のことなので訂正しました。

sen.j: - 漉し餡に米粉を加えてそぼろ状に仕上げた物。
sen.e: This is a cake made by adding rice flour to koshi-an bean paste and mincing it up.
This is a cake made by adding rice flour to koshi-an bean paste and mincing the ingredients.
